aicpa-topic.title: About AICPA Guides

body.p: This AICPA guide has been developed by the AICPA Stockbrokerage and Investment Banking Expert Panel to assist management in the preparation of their financial statements in conformity with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP).

The AICPA staff has been authorized to make conforming changes to AICPA guides with the approval of the chair of the AICPA Auditing Standards Board (ASB) or the chair of the Financial Reporting Executive Committee (FinREC) (or their designees), as appropriate. Such authorization was originally made by the AICPA board of directors in 1990, and the board resolution defines conforming changes as "revisions intended to effect changes necessitated by the issuance of authoritative pronouncements." Conforming changes are carefully and judiciously made and are normally limited to items that result from the issuance of new authoritative literature. Conforming changes also include nonaccounting and nonauditing revisions that modify, add, or delete regulatory guidance and industry background information in response to changes in the regulatory and industry environment. Conforming changes do not include recent legislative programs or other governmental measures or industry actions that may have been taken as a result of the current economic environment.

AICPA guides may include certain content presented as “supplement,” “appendix,” or “exhibit.” A supplement is a reproduction, in whole or in part, of authoritative guidance originally issued by a standard-setting body (including regulatory bodies) and applicable to entities or engagements within the purview of that standard setter, independent of the authoritative status of the applicable AICPA guide. Both appendixes and exhibits are included for informational purposes and have no authoritative status.
